Title: Detached construction
References: ŠTULAJTEROVÁ, A., JESENSKÁ, P.: English Stylistics. 1. vyd. Banská Bystrica : Univerzita Mateja Bela, 2013. 114 s.
Content:
Detached construction occurs when one of the secondary parts of a sentence is deliberately placed so that it seems formally independent of the word it logically refers to.

The detached part, being torn away from its referent, assumes a greater degree of significance and is given prominence by intonation and punctuation.

example:

  • She was lively: all of her - delightful
